climbs.name: Traditional Fairytale
climbs.fa: Jon Ruland, Jen Ivey, Eric Ivey

content.description: This is the obvious crack running up the narrow south face of the tower.  It finishes under the big roof at a set of rap anchors. This would be a good first trad lead for new climbers.
content.protection: Gear to 3 inches.  Note, gear at the start is tricky, but a 3" cam with a long runner or a slung chickenhead will tame the opening moves, even if it comes off as you pass it.  Should get you safely established into the crack.

content.description: On the east side of the tower there's an obvious line that starts up a dihedral to a ledge.  From the ledge head up the narrow face to a headwall.  If you stop before the headwall it's 5.7. Topping out is 10-.

climbs.name: Happily Never After
climbs.fa: Jon Ruland, Eric Ivey, Jen Ivey

content.description: 5.9 crack leads up to steep ledges on good holds with powerful moves, eventually to a steep, blank face.   Crux is up high - and all 5.10 climbing is bolted.
content.location: The downhill route on the west side of Rapunzel's Tower

content.description: This is the first half of Happily Never After, but bails to the right before the crux to the anchor of Traditional Fairytale.
content.location: Left side of the Rapunzel Tower.

climbs.name: The Golden Stair
climbs.fa: Eric Ivey, Jon Ruland, Jen Ivey

content.description: Starts in a dihedral and heads up steep ledges on good holds, then finishes up with a vertical face. Very fun!
content.protection: .5 - 2" cams, stoppers.  Two #2s (BD) are helpful up high.
content.location: West side of Rapunzel's Tower, the uphill route.

content.description: This is the central tower-like formation with climbs on 3 sides.  All but one route can be TRed by hiking around the left side to the top.    The 2 climbs on the left side of the formation are unfinished and should not be climbed, since there are no anchors.
